intro: Craterocapsa insizwae, commonly known as the Zulu starwort, is a small, herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its star-shaped leaves and tiny, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a low-growing habit with succulent stems that help it retain moisture. Craterocapsa insizwae is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
